title: Steelers QB Ben Roethlisberger says he wants to play Sunday, but it's not up to him
text:
Steelers QB Ben Roethlisberger says he wants to play Sunday, but it’s not up to him Resize Text By Marissa Payne October 14 at 11:43 AM Follow @marissapayne (Gene J. Puskar/AP) 
If Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Ben Roehlisberger gets his way this weekend, he’ll be playing against the Arizona Cardinals on Sunday. According to ESPN’s Jeremy Fowler, the 33-year-old said he will go through the team’s 7-on-7 drills in practice on Wednesday to prepare. The quarterback, who was injured in Week 3 when he sprained his MCL and suffered a bone bruise against the St. Louis Rams, added that he’s able to throw the ball without a problem but needs to still work on lateral movement. Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger said he plans to participate in 7-on-7 work in today's practice. He wants… http://t.co/3bA5jYjZnA 
— Jeremy Fowler (@JFowlerESPN) October 14, 2015 
Just because Roethlisberger wants to play, however, doesn’t mean he will. The decision will ultimately be made by Coach Mike Tomlin in conjunction with team doctors. Sounds like Oct. 25 vs. #Chiefs more likely RT @ProFootballTalk : Roethlisberger plans to do 7-on-7 work on Wednesday http://t.co/ordDx0aK2P 
— Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) October 14, 2015 
In Roethlisberger’s absence, backup quarterback Michael Vick has been Pittsburgh’s starter for the last two weeks. His last game was more successful that his first. The Steelers beat the San Diego Chargers, 24-20, on Monday after Vick threw a 72-yard touchdown pass to tie the score and Le’Veon Bell followed it up with a wildcat play to win. 
The Steelers are 3-2 this season and currently stand in second place in the AFC North.
